summary: Alligators are large reptiles found in two species: the American alligator and the Chinese alligator. They belong to the Crocodile family and have been around for about 37 million years. The name 'alligator' comes from the Spanish word 'el lagarto,' meaning 'the lizard.' Early explorers in Florida gave them this name. Alligators are often called 'gators' for short.
title: Alligator
